meanings.definition: A traditional dress worn by women in Germany, typically consisting of a bodice and full skirt.
meanings.sent1: During Oktoberfest, many women wear dirndls to celebrate.
meanings.sent2: The dirndls displayed in the shop window were colorful and beautifully embroidered.
meanings.sent3: The dirndls at the costume party made everyone feel like they had traveled back in time.
meanings.sent4: Her dirndls were like a rainbow swirling around her as she danced.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the dirndls were a feast for the eyes.

meanings.sent1: In the wardrobe, there were several dirndls hanging neatly in a row.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends decided to all wear dirndls to the festival.
meanings.sent3: The dirndls on the clothesline outside fluttered in the breeze like colorful flags.
meanings.sent4: The dirndls in the store seemed to multiply as more customers came in.
meanings.sent5: The collection of dirndls was a sight to behold, each one unique in its design.
